Description: Fragment of neck and oval handle rising to sharp turn of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Clay fine brown-buff; cream slip. Rectangular stamp.
Curator's comments: Ink, deleted, '267'. Name Ieron. Same die is used for an example in the Benaki collection, Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, not in Senol.
Bibliographic references: Stoddart 1847 / Memoir on the inscribed pottery of Rhodes, Cnidus and other Greek Cities (164)
